title: Variable Name Validator
description: Identify valid variable names in a programming language. They must start with a letter or underscore, and can be followed by any number of letters, numbers, or underscores.
solutionSummary: This pattern validates variable names. The first character class `[a-zA-Z_]` ensures the name starts with a letter or underscore. The second character class `[a-zA-Z0-9_]` allows letters, numbers, or underscores for the rest of the name. The `*` quantifier means the second part can appear zero or more times.
